changelist.comment:
This file describes substitutions that are done in the process of preparing text for typesetting; such as replacing spaces between consecutive quotation marks with narrow non-breaking spaces or letter pairs with ligatures. Changes are done by the program sequentially, starting with the first replacement and going to the last, on each string between USFM or USFX tags.
In some applications, it may be desireable to make a consistent change including a unicode character that is hard to type or see in this file. Therefore, you may use U+ followed by the Unicode hexadecimal code point to indicate a Unicode character in the "old" or "new" elements. For example, U+00A0 is the same as a non-breaking space.
This particular change list changes greater-than and less-than symbols to typographic quotation marks, normalizes the spacing between single and double typographic quotation marks, and replaces two dashes with a single em-dash.
